{{Afc mass}} Please now follow the link back to [[Wikipedia:Articles for creation]]. == [[Fast Kill Records]] == {{#switch:|accept={{afc a}}|mm={{afc mm}}|#default={{afc r}}}} Fast Kill Records is a record label founded by Nick Williams and Ken Demofonte, best known for their role as founders of and musicians in the Philadelphia based thrash metal band Flash Fire, in 2005 when they came to the realization that they had the knowledge and ability to manage and promote their band without the assistance of an external staff. The label specializes in heavy metal bands, more specifically thrash, black, death, neo-classical, and progressive genres. === Sources === http://www.fastkillrecords.com [[User:69.141.7.219|69.141.7.219]] 00:47, 8 June 2006 (UTC)

'''Please do not modify it.''''' |} == [[OfficeGateway]] == {{#switch:|accept={{afc a}}|mm={{afc mm}}|#default={{afc r}}}} [http://www.officegateway.ca OfficeGateway] was developed by Evolving Solutions, located in Saint John, New Brunswick. It was developed as a means of providing affordable access to the power of collaboration to small & mid-sized business. The product leverages existing open source projects such as MySQL, Liferay, Linux and Lucene. OfficeGateway provides a personalized portal and online collaboration system for companies seeking to streamline business processes for greater efficiency, growth and profitability, by offering a "single point of contact" for employees, clients and project teams. The result: connected, organized and effective business teams. OfficeGateway answers the needs of mobile workers, remote sites and all forms of corporate mobility. By combining affordability, security and ease of use, OfficeGateway turbo-charges the growing enterprise by connecting their assets and unlocking their potential. Whatever the business or information sharing needs, OfficeGateway has the ideal collaboration solution in a powerful, easy-to-use, suite of services. Features: * Webmail * Shared & Personal Calendar * CRM/Invoicing * News Feeds (RSS) * Contact Center * Announcements * Document Library * Polls * RSS Reader * SMS Email Text Messaging * To Do List * Translator * Currency Converter * Bookmarks * Company Directory === Sources === www.liferay.com

'''Please do not modify it.''''' |} == [[Nikki Lee|nikki s. lee]] == {{#switch:|accept={{afc a}}|mm={{afc mm}}|#default={{afc r}}}} Nikki S.Lee is a Korean-born, New York City based artist, photographer, and filmmaker. Her most notable works, Projects, documents her socialization with various American and immigrant subcultures. These socialization projects, photographed by Lee's friends or passing strangers and exhibited as snapshots, have been the subject of widely divergent interpretations and critiques. More recent works include a series called Parts, which the artist arranges photographs of herself in couple shots while her partner is obscured. Most recently, the artist has undertaken a documentary wherein one of her manifestations of her self documents the daily life of another manifestation of her self. === Sources === Nikki S.Lee: Projects. ed. Lesley A. Martin, New YorK: Hatje Cantz 2001 [[User:164.67.59.89|164.67.59.89]] 01:08, 8 June 2006 (UTC)

'''Please do not modify it.''''' |} == [[White Bear, Saskatchewan]] == {{#switch:accept|accept={{afc a}}|mm={{afc mm}}|#default={{afc r}}}} White Bear, Saskatchewan is a small hamlet located approximately 55 miles northwest of [[Swift Current]], SK on the north side of the South Saskatchewan River. Its name comes from the sighting of a probable but now extirpated white prairie grizzly bear[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brown_Bear] by an [[Assiniboine]] warrior on the shores of a neighboring lake during the [[Palliser Expedition]] of the 1850’s. Records from early Metis settlers and the [[NWMP]] state the last roaming herd of [[American buffalo]] being slaughtered in the hills of the Missouri Coteau located 25 miles northeast around 1879. During the 1930’s White Bear was a bustling community of approximately 250 residents with two grocery stores, a school, four elevators and three garages servicing an area of 200 families, but has since dwindled to a population of 13 in 2006. Part of the death is attributed to federal policy changes regarding agriculture, the routing of the No. 4 Highway through the neighboring town of Kyle, and the later abandonment of the CN Rail line in that area of Saskatchewan. It is interesting to note that the region rarely suffered poor crops, except during the droughts of the [[Great Depression]] and 1988. It is connected to the rest of the province through Highway 342, albeit a now-decrepit road featuring signs with Imperial units in portions. Farmers from the area played prominently in the socialism that would later define Saskatchewan then Canada through the introduction of Medicare [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medicare_%28Canada%29] and state-ran insurance[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saskatchewan_Government_Insurance]. The White Bear Hotel remains the only business in operation, noted for its hot wings and hospitality. === Sources === http://www.bigthings.ca/sask/wbear.html [[User:129.128.183.205|129.128.183.205]] 01:26, 8 June 2006 (UTC)

R.G. Eckert == {{#switch:accept|accept={{afc a}}|mm={{afc mm}}|#default={{afc r}}}} Eckert was born in 1904 in Prague, where he studied at the German Institute of Technology. He developed methods for jet engine turbine blade cooling at a research laboratory in Prague. He emigrated to the United States after the [[World War II]]. He authored more than 500 articles and received several awards for his contributions to science. His book "Introduction to the Transfer of Heat and Mass," published in 1937, is still considered a fundamental text in the field. He had many students including [[R. J. Goldtein]] and his last students G. Bar-Meir. === Sources === *[http://www.potto.org/gasDynamics/node49.html short bio of Eckert] *[http://www.potto.org/gasDynamics/index.html Fundamentals of compressible Flow] [[User:209.32.159.25|209.32.159.25]] 02:16, 8 June 2006 (UTC)potto

'''Please do not modify it.''''' |} == [[VERTX]] == {{#switch:|accept={{afc a}}|mm={{afc mm}}|#default={{afc r}}}} '''BIOGRAPHY:''' Music lover and Entertainer: Mike Katz / DJ Vertx was turned onto the party circuit while it was in its largest movement - the late nineties. He first started organizing and hosting rave-themed events in mid 2001, starting off with a fully versatile line up, and eventually focused his interest and time on more particular styles, splitting his love of music between two separate themes. One being the ever-growing Drum-n-Bass and Heavy-Jungle oriented genres with their addictive rolling baselines, anthems, and dark fast paced styles. The second and more commonly played tunes contain a full collection of all forms of Hip-Hop spiced with some Dance-Hall and Reggae. Vertx gradually found himself often manipulating all of the above forms of music together and taught himself how to read a crowd in order to build a vibe that left people always wanting to come back and hear more. Through much admiration and respect for the scene and those in it Vertx continues hosting and playing events on a regular basis, focusing not only on the New York Metro areas of Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, and Long Island, but is currently touring the country sponsored by Captain Morgan liquor. Previously featured on Demostreams.com (now defunct), the founder of UNDERSTANDINC (NYC) NO DRAMA STATESIDE and NO DRAMA WORLDWIDE as well as 1LEVELUP Marketing, Vertx has been sponsored by BEWILD.com along with SOBE ADRENALINE energy drinks and most currently Captain Morgan’s. '''Please do not modify it.''''' |} == [[Vicki Hyde]] == {{#switch:|accept={{afc a}}|mm={{afc mm}}|#default={{afc r}}}} Vicki Hyde is a science author, editor and co-owner with her husband Peter of a New Zealand-based software and web development company, Webcentre Ltd. Hyde is best known as the Managing Editor of the popular science portal site [[ScitechDaily]], which she began as a sister site to [[Arts & Letters Daily]] soon after the latter was launched in 1998 by her friend, [[Denis Dutton]]. Hyde's company also worked with Dutton in 1998 to launch the [[Cybereditions]] Ebook and print-on-demand publishing operation, which Webcentre owns outright. Hyde was also founder and Managing Editor of New Zealand Science Monthly magazine which was published for the full decade from 1990 to 2000. During that time she authored Godzone Skies, Astronomy for New Zealanders and helped launch and market Webcentre's flagship [[TurboNote]] software. She is the long-standing Chair-Entity of the New Zealand Skeptics (NZ Committee for Scientific Investigation of Claims of the Paranormal, Inc) and in 2006 will be publishing a book on paranormal phenomena and investigation in New Zealand. In her leisure time, Hyde can be found in an alternate persona as the Baroness of Southron Gaard, a branch of the international [[Society for Creative Anachronism]]. === Sources === ScitechDaily -- http://scitechdaily.com Webcentre Ltd -- http://webcentre.co.nz/people.htm Cybereditions - http://cybereditions.com New Zealand Science Monthly - http://nzsm.spis.co.nz/ TurboNote -- http://TurboNote.com Southron Gaard (SCA) -- http://sg.sca.org.nz Godzone Skies, Astronomy for New Zealanders, ISBN 0-908812-19-1/0908812191 [[User:203.173.189.155|203.173.189.155]] 03:47, 8 June 2006 (UTC) *Created a stub before I realised this was here - I've just incorporated text from your proposal into it. '''Please do not modify it.''''' |} == [[Abbey Road on the River]] == {{#switch:|accept={{afc a}}|mm={{afc mm}}|#default={{afc r}}}} Abbey Road on the River is a Beatles fest originally started in Cleavland in 2002. In 2005 it moved to it's current home in Louisville, KY. Each year it is held on Memorial Day weekend, lasting three days. '''Please do not modify it.''''' |} == Wesley Crichlow == {{#switch:|accept={{afc a}}|mm={{afc mm}}|#default={{afc r}}}} Dr. Wesley Crichlow is a tenured Associate Professor in the Faculty of Social Science at the University of Ontario Institute of Technology in Oshawa, Canada, where he teaches Introduction to Criminal Law, Introduction to Customs and Immigration Law, Introduction to the Canadian Legal System, Rights and Freedoms in The Canadian Justice System, and Diversity and Legal Issues in Law. Prior to arriving at UOIT, he taught in the Faculty of Law at Carleton University and in the Faculty of Education at Ontario Institute for Studies in Education at the University of Toronto. His research interests are in Black youth gang violence, social inequality, theoretical and legal approaches to the study of race, human rights, racial profiling and driving while Black, the racialization of alternative dispute resolution, moral regulation, racialized gay and lesbian rights, critical apprisal of youth restorative justice, new immigrant employment and accreditation training; judicial reform, and section 15 criminal law charter challenges. He is the author of the first academic Canadian scholarly published book/text entitled Buller Men & Batty Bwoys: Hidden Men in Toronto and Halifax's Black Communities Published by the University of Toronto Press, 2003. His refereed journal publications include: Understanding the World of the Black Child Published in Orbit, a co-publication of the Ontario Institute for Studies in Education at the University of Toronto and Nelson Educational Services, Volume 25, Number 2, 1994; Contemporary Literature Review: Homophobia and Black Ideologues Establishing the Frameworks. Insurgent Voices in Education: Violence in Education Volume 2. Trans/forms a Graduate Students Journal at the Ontario Institute for Studies in Education, University of Toronto, 1996; Western Colonization as Disease: Native Adoption & Cultural Genocide. In Critical Social Work, an eâ€‘journal dedicated to a critical analysis of social work and social issues, 2003; Western Colonization as Disease: Native Adoption & Cultural Genocide. The Journal of Canadian Social Work, Volume 5 - Autumn 2003 - Number 1. His publications in edited scholarly books include: Introduction to Understanding Policing, edited by K. McCormick and L. Visano (1992); Black Migration, Identity and a Black Same-Sex Consciousness: Ma'ka Diasporic Juks: Contemporary Writing by Queers of African Descent. Edited by Makeda Silvera, Debbie Douglas, Douglas Stewart and Courtney McFarlane, (Sister Vision Press) 1997; Buller Men and Batty Bwoys. Published in a Queer Country: Gay and Lesbian Studies in the Canadian Context. Edited by Dr. Terry Goldie, (Arsenal Pulp Press, 2001) nominated for the 14th Annual Lambada Non-Fiction Literary Award 2001; Facing Race Before The Courts: Diversity and Implications for the Judiciary. Published on the National Judicial Institute Website for Judges (NJI). Ottawa, 2000; Black Male Rastafarianism: Racism and Stereotyping: Commission des droits de la personne et des droits de le jeunesse. Quebec Human Rights Commission 2000; Black History, Colonialism, Memory, Testimony & Biomythography: The Charting of a Buller Man`s Trinidadian Past. Published in Interrogating Caribbean Masculinities: Theoretical and Empirical Analysis. Edited by Dr. Rhoda Reddock. University of the West Indies Press-Trinidad and Tobago, 2004 and Paper Accepted for Publishing entitled History, (Re)Memory, Testimony and Biomythography: Charting a Buller Man's Trinidadian Past in an edited book collection entitled A Fi We Time: Contemporary Caribbean & Lesbian Writing" Publisher - Duke University Press. 2005. Dr. Crichlow holds a PhD from the University of Toronto (Ontario Institute for the Studies in Education) and certificates in Alternative Dispute Resolution and Ontario Civil Justice Review from the combined program offered with the law firm STITT FELD HANDY - Toronto and the University of Windsor Faculty of Law, 2004. Amazon book site: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/0802089429/ref=cm_lm_fullview_prod_1/002-8373378-6939254?%5Fencoding=UTF8&v=glance&n=283155 http://www.criminologyandjustice.uoit.ca/EN/main/35828/Crichlow_Bio.html http://www.nowtoronto.com/issues/17/41/News/front.html

'''Please do not modify it.''''' |} == [[ Charles Hagedon Guy ]] == {{#switch:|accept={{afc a}}|mm={{afc mm}}|#default={{afc r}}}} Someone who know Wikipedia better than I, please help me make this the best artical that it can be. ok, here goes...... Charles Guy is from Champagne, south of Chicago. He was my best friend for years. While a student in Chicago he was a DJ at a local radio station, perhaps the college's radio station. Charles loved wierd music that was mostly things like electronic noise, feedback, and smashing things like TVs on stage. Before Charles and I met he had worked for BAO (Bruce Arwick Organization, not 100% sure of the spelling). Later he was at Microsoft, when He and Tony Zander created the bulk of what became MS Space Simulator. Charles told me that Zander was the greates game artist he'd ever worked with. (I guess Zander could use an artical as well. Zander was still at MS at least until 2002) Charles went to school or worked with Eric Albers and Chris Green, the founders of Leaping Lizard software in Gaithersburg, MD. About 1/2 hour outside of Washington DC. When I joined Leaping Lizard Charles and Chris and Eric were already programming a computer game Called Warhammer 40,000: Dark Crusaders. The company was very small, and office space was limited so Charles and I shared an office togther. A few years later Charles came to work at Zombie VR studios in Seattle, where I was already working. We helped make Spec-Ops: Rangers lead the way. At Zombie Charles programed the engine that allowed us to make the first commerically available 3D VR forest. After Zombie Charles did a few really neat things, and eventually went to work in California maintaining and improving the servers for the Everquest online Game. About 5 years ago he got cancer and died. and I really really miss him. He was that kind of guy (another pun) who you woould ask any kind of question and he'd be able to answer you. He taught me my love of astronomy. He had a cat named Smudge. a note about Leaping Lizard, people who worked at LL went on to do some very cool things, and the owners had already made some famous titles. Here's a short list of LL people and their games. Chris Green: The Elder Scrolls: Arena made by Bethesdia Software Eric Albers: Made Simfarm singlehandedly for Maxis. Bernie, who got his first job at LL went on to work on Halo: Combat Evolved for Microsoft, and Spec-Ops: Rangers Lead the way for Zombie VR Studios. (Bernie and I actually worked together at LL, Zombie, and at Microsoft's Bungie. Missy Castro made games for LL and Sierra === Sources === www.geocities.com/headbiter this webpage has my own little memorial to the Guy (hey look a pun) I'll try and find some more info. '''Please do not modify it.''''' |} == [[Lead Acid Batteries]] == #REDIRECT [[Lead-acid battery]] === Sources === == [[Spawn of Kyuss]] == Spawn of Kyuss are a [[fictional]] breed of [[undead]] from the [[role-playing game]] [[Dungeons & Dragons]]. As their name suggests, they are heavily associated with the [[Greyhawk]] diety Kyuss. Spawn of Kyuss are intelligent and free-willed undead, though they are obsessed with accomplishing the goals of their creator-god Kyuss, primarily through spreading corruption. In appearance, Spawn of Kyuss closely resemble zombies, though they are differentiated by the multitude of bilious green worms that infest their dead flesh. These worms are particularly prone to slithering out of the Spawn's mouth and eye-sockets. These worms posses a strange symbiotic link with their undead host; the worms perish after several minutes if seperated from their host. The sole exceptions are if the worm is stored in a potion of Quiet Repose or brought into contact with living flesh, whereupon it instantly begins burrowing through flesh and bone to reach the nervous system and, from there, the brain. Devouring the victim's brain transforms the victim into a new Spawn of Kyuss. The symbiotic link is not one way though; a Spawn somehow seperated from its swarming worms also perishes rapidly. Spawn of Kyuss posses extremely potent auras of magical fear, and are made equally fearsome in combat due to their ability to both attempt to infest their opponents with worms of Kyuss, turning them into new Spawn, and their ability to regenerate damage. Spawn of Kyuss and their master Kyuss have featured heavily in recent issues of [[Dragon (magazine)|Dragon Magazine]] and [[Dungeon Magazine]] due to the publishing of the "Age of Worms" adventure path. Dragon Magazine #336 features an article on the Ecology of the Spawn of the Kyuss, which not only discusses the Spawn but also features a template for Favoured Spawn of Kyuss as well as an updated Divine Profile for Kyuss himself. As of Dragon Magazine #336, this has been Kyuss's official profile. Kyuss's clasical manifestation is a guant man with empty eye sockets filled with writhing green worms and with hands of bare bone. His new manifestation is reported as a humanoid-shaped mass of writhing green worms. Kyuss is a Demigod of Neutral Evil alignment. Symbol: a human skull with green worms in the mouth and eye sockets. Portfolio: creation and control of the undead, decay, unholy transformation of the flesh, worms Domains: Death, Destruction, Evil (Games Masters using the Book of Vile Darkness accessory can also add Corruption to this list) Favoured Weapon: Club Clerical Training: new cultists must undergo a ritual known as First Ingestion to prove their loyalty, which consists of drinking a potion of Inflict Light Wounds that contains a preserved Worm of Kyuss. Quests: luring powerful individuals into the worship of Kyuss and deceiving members of other faiths so they serve Kyuss's goals are most commong. Prayers: Kyuss's servants pray to him once a month in a ritual that involves the consumption of live worms. Temples: in remote locations far from civilisation, vast subterranian temples and tabernacles are dedicated to Kyuss. Rites: Kyuss's servants prepare for his return, the legendary Age of the Worms, and undertake a variety of goals to achieve this end. Herald and Allies: Kyuss's Herald is an Red Dracolich named Dragotha, and his most common reponse to Planar Ally spells are demons with the Favoured Spawn of Kyuss template. === Sources === "Ecology of the Spawn of Kyuss", Dragon Magazine #336 October 2005. '''Please do not modify it.''''' |} == [[MEZ - military exclusion zone]] == {{#switch:accept|accept={{afc a}}|mm={{afc mm}}|#default={{afc r}}}} A military exclusion zone (MEZ) is an area in the immediate vicinity of a military action established by a country to prevent the unauthorized entry of civilian personnel/equipment for their own safety or to protect natural assets already in place in the zone. It is also established to prevent an enemy from acquiring any materiel which could help them. === Sources === Main Entry: exclusion zone Part of Speech: noun Definition: an area where entry is forbidden, esp. involving foreign transport Source: Webster's New Millennium™ Dictionary of English, Preview Edition (v 0.9.6) Copyright © 2003-2005 Lexico Publishing Group, LLC [[User:158.106.50.3|158.106.50.3]] 11:18, 8 June 2006 (UTC)David Bridges[[User:158.106.50.3|158.106.50.3]] 11:18, 8 June 2006 (UTC)

'''Please do not modify it.''''' |} == [[SCAMPER]] == The SCAMPER is a creativity thinking technique for inventing new product or change existing one. The SCAMPER stands for are: S - Substitute - components, materials, people C - Combine - mix, combine with other assemblies or services, integrate A - Adapt - alter, change function, use part of another element M - Modify - increase or reduce in scale, change shape, modify attributes (e.g. colour) P - Put to another use E - Eliminate - remove elements, simplify, reduce to core functionality R - Reverse - turn inside out or upside down. === Sources === Web: http://www.mycoted.com/SCAMPER http://www.mindtools.com/pages/article/newCT_02.htm Book: http://www.amazon.co.uk/exec/obidos/ASIN/0898154081/ref=ase_crinnothescie-21/203-5204438-6467939 See also [[Generic programming]] === Sources === == six basic sentence pattern == === Sources === The Sentence: Six Basic Patterns Built On Verb Types Basic sentence patterns are built around verbs. There are six different verb types that are followed by structures always associated with those verbs. Therefore, there are six basic sentence patterns, which are also called sentence nuclei. Once these basic patterns are understood, other structures may be attached to the sentence nuclei to form larger sentences. These other structures added to the sentence nuclei are usually phrases or clauses that function as nouns, verbs, adjective and adverbs. 1. The first verb type is called "intransitive." This type of verb can end the sentence, or it can be followed by an adverb phrase. Intransitive verbs do not need to be followed by noun phrases or adjective phrases. 1a. The president spoke. 1b. Margo slept. 1c. Margo slept soundly. 1d. The small boy jumped from the high oak tree. 1e. Jimmy went to London. 2. The second verb type is called "linking." This type of verb must be followed by noun phrases or adjective phrases, which refer to the same person or thing as the subject of the sentence. Some typical linking verbs are become, appear, grow, remain, stay, and seem. Some other linking verbs involving the senses are feel, look, smell, sound, and taste. Note that the forms of the verb "be" are placed in a special category below, because forms of "be," unlike other linking verbs, can be followed immediately by an "adverb of place." 2a. Clark Kent became Superman. 2b. The president looked weary. 2c. Jamal remained an honest man. 3. The third verb type is the word "be" and all its forms, which is a special category of linking verb. The verb "be," unlike other linking verbs, can be followed by a phrase functioning as an "adverb of place," in addition to the noun phrases or adjective phrases that follow other types of linking verbs. The word "be" has eight forms: be, is, am, are, was, were, been, being. 3a. The student is a math whiz. 3b. Marilyn was insecure. 3c. The new houses are around the corner. (The verb is followed by a phrase functioning as an adverb of place.) 4. The fourth verb type is "one-place transitive." This verb must be followed by a noun phrase that functions as a direct object. Often the subject "does something" to this object. Sentences with transitive verbs can usually be turned into passive sentences. Note that some intransitive verbs can also be used as transitive verbs. 4a. The office manager typed the letter. 4b. Satellites monitor the country's military bases. 4c. The country's military bases are monitored by satellites. (Sentence 4b is changed to a passive sentence.) 5. The fifth verb type is "Vg two-place transitive." This "Vg" verb can be followed by one of two structures. In the first pattern, the verb is followed by two noun phrases, with the first noun phrase functioning as an indirect object, and the second functioning as a direct object. The alternate sentence pattern is related to the first, but the first noun phrase is a direct object, and the second is an indirect object placed in a prepositional phrase introduced by "to" or "for," or more rarely by "of." Sentences formed from "Vg" verbs must always have both direct and indirect objects. Although indirect objects are usually living things, they can also be inanimate objects. 5a. Dennis bought Ann some fancy flowers. 5b. Scientists fed some nutritious food to the laboratory rats. 5c. The Governor gave the schools additional money. 5d. The senator asked a question of the Supreme Court Justice. 6. The sixth verb type is "Vc two-place transitive." This "Vc" verb is followed by a noun phrase that functions as a direct object, plus another noun phrase, adjective phrase, or infinitive phrase that functions as a complement. The term "complement" refers to a structure that completes a phrase or clause. 6a. Republicans consider Democrats big spenders. 6b. Excessive tax cuts make some people uncomfortable. 6c. Some historians believe Franklin Roosevelt to be our most effective president. '''Please do not modify it.''''' |} == Galligaskin == Baggy trousers worn by sailors of the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries. This word was a fanciful corruption of French garguesque, "in the Greek style," hinting at their place of origin. Galligaskins were not always spoken of directly in polite conversation. The first recorded substitute for them was inexpressibles in 1790, which suited Victorian taste so well that a rash of euphemisms emerged in the 1830s and 1840s, including unmentionables, inexplicables, unutterables, and the superlative unwhisperables. === Sources === http://saint-esprit.freeservers.com/forgotten.html [[User:84.0.201.26|84.0.201.26]] 12:32, 8 June 2006 (UTC) == Your Penis == {{#switch:|accept={{afc a}}|mm={{afc mm}}|#default={{afc r}}}} ''This article is a stub. Adapted from the [[David Shrigley]] book of the same title published by [[Redstone]]. This black and white animation is the story of a derranged man who lives in woods called Pete, voiced by [[Kevin Eldon]]. Despite being only seven minutes in duration. The film manages to show Pete's life warts and all. The film premiered at the [[London Film Festival]] in October 2005. Winner of many international awards, including, "Audience Award" at [[British Animation Awards]] and prestigious "Tiger Award" at [[Rotterdam International Film Festival]]. The film was released on DVD by [[onedotzero]] and [[slinky pictures]] June 2006. === Credits === "Who I Am And What I Want" A film by [[Chris Shepherd]] and [[David Shrigley]] Voice [[Kevin Eldon]] A [[Slinky Pictures]] production. '''Please do not modify it.''''' |} == vince craft == Vince Craft enjoys long walks on the beach, shooting paper into trash cans and loves pretending like hes good at basketball. If given the oppurtunity, he would love to make one special lady, his own === Sources === == [[Buyun Zhao]] == === Sources === == [[Attraction to Disability]] == Sexual deviations like acrotomophilia (amelotasis), apotemnophilia, abasiophilia, teratophilia and the desire for partners with other disabilities. Resume An overview of disability paraphilias. Terms: devotees (disability paraphiliacs), pretenders (ones pretending they have disabilities), wannabes (ones desiring to become disabled). Keywords: acrotomophilia, amelotasis, amputation, amputee(s), apotemnophilia, BIID (Body Integrity Identity Disorder), body dysmoprphia, devotees, disability devotees, disability fetishism, disability wannabes, disability pretenders, fetish, fetishism, pretenders, wannabes. History Allusions to the attraction are found in Herodotus, works by Breugel the Elder, Michel de Montaigne, Pushkin, Bulgakov, Dali, Brecht, von Stroheim, Bunuel and James Dean. It has become better known since the late 19th Century and the 1960s’ Sexual Revolution. A community of disability devotees is emerging in the internet. Nature Devotees desire sexual partners with disabilities, mostly amputations. An invisible pale desires partners with developmental and intellectual disabilities. Over half of all devotees feel the attraction since childhood. Some cannot attribute its emergence to a specific occasion. Others cherish memories of objects of their future attention. About a quarter of devotees discover the attraction in puberty, and some do so after sexual maturity. Each devotee has strictly defined preferences. Thus, most acrotomophiles feel weak desire or no desire for partners with other disabilities. There are plentiful additional definitions for each devotee on matters such as whether the disability was acquired or congenital, et c. The desire to acquire a disability may be viewed as a peculiar variation of the attraction. Called wannabes, those who experience it suffer from Body Integrity Identity Disorder (BIID) or body dysmorphia (apotemnophilia if they desire to become amputees) and appear to number not more than one in 20 of all devotees. That wannabeism is a logical extension of devoteeism is an assumption. The similarities and differences between devotees and wannabes are hotly debated in the devotee community. Population By mid-2006, the virtual world devotee community comprised some 100,000 members of dedicated internet fora. The uneven distribution of internet, the passivity of most members of each community, and the probable ‘grey zone’ of those who belong to the community only partially may bear out assumptions that there are about a third of a million devotees worldwide. There are indications that while in most countries there is one or fewer devotees per million population, in First World nations the incidence rises to about 100 devotees per million. By sex over nine in every ten devotees are male, yet the subculture does contain female devotees. By sexual orientation, the share of homosexual and bisexual devotees appears identical to that in the general population. An appropriate glance at the population of people with disabilities shows them as predominantly elderly: up to 80 per cent of them are over the retirement age. According to different data and thresholds, disabled people form up to a tenth of the population. Delving further, amputees are not more than one per cent of disabled people, and over 80 per cent of them are men. Leg amputations predominate at almost 80 per cent of this total, with above-knee ones accounting for under 20 per cent of the subtotal. Behaviour For devotees, a disability does not reduce a potential partner’s attractiveness but significantly boosts it. No cases are known in which a devotee has physically harmed a partner with a disability or caused disability to an able-bodied partner. Wannabes regularly engage in self-harm, often with fatal outcomes. It appears that a fair number of devotees succeed in establishing the relationships they desire. It is often claimed that such relationships are ordinary, the attraction being sated by the mere presence of a disability. There appear, however, to be certain peculiarities in such relationships. Successful devotees often go through a series of relationships: something explained by the fact that sexual satiety may not necessarily satisfy broader emotional needs (similar patterns exist among other sexual minorities such as some gay men). Also, devotees may press their disabled partners to put their disabilities to the forefront in intimate situations and exhibit them in social ones. Over half of all devotees fail to establish their desired relationships. Those who have not become aware of themselves as devotees often harbour guilty thoughts and feel themselves to be unique. Over the past decade, a number of devotees have opened websites with images of their ideal partners (often retouched photographs of able bodied people). Other sites carry descriptions of fictional encounters between devotees and desired partners, drawings of such partners, and devotee pornography (often produced in cooperation with disabled people). Many devotees direct their desires into creative pursuits. Ukrainian theatre director Andriy Zholdak produces plays with amputees, British sculptor Mark Quinn displays statues of amputees on Trafalgar Square in London, art photographers Gerhard Aba, Eric Croll and Yuriy Solomenko photograph amputees, directors produce films like Crime Delicado and Boxing Helena with amputees, balletomanes produce dance shows with amputees. Some devotees collect personal data about desired persons, follow and photograph them candidly, engineer seemingly spontaneous meetings with them, call them by telephone, and seek them out in healthcare establishments and civic gatherings of disabled people. An unknown number of devotees hold jobs providing contact with disabled people. Others are members of societies, sporting clubs, et c., of people with disabilities. Collecting objects linked with disability is a pastime for some devotees. Pretending is another expression of the paraphilia. Some devotees derive sexual pleasure by pretending to have a disability. Others persuade partners to pretend. Pretending usually takes place in privacy or intimacy, but may occasionally be practiced in public. There have been complaints that, in dedicated devotee chatrooms, male devotees en masse pretend to be women with disabilities; if true, this would suggest the broadest aptitude to pretending among devotees. The putative continuum between non-pretending devotees, pretenders, and wannabes has not been researched. Online, devotees exchange descriptions of sightings of disabled people, experiences of meetings with them, biographies of famous people with disabilities, techniques for attracting their attention, and opinions on acceptable/unacceptable devotee behaviour. There are attempts to condemn the objectification of disabled people. Wannabe fora are dominated by enquiries as to which doctors may be willing to perform elective amputations of healthy limbs. The devotee community has a growing English-based internal terminology which emerged in the 1930s. The word ‘devotee,’ adopted in the early 1980s due to its alliteration with ‘amputee’ is entering research usage. Explanations The attraction is rarely visited by scientific literature and has not been subjected to rigorous research. While depriving interested parties of information, this suggests that devotees have not caused concern among disabled people and the public. In contrast, there is much interest and many publications on the much smaller number of wannabes, indicating significant public concern. Some explanations are at odds with each other, yet a number are repeated by all relevant sides. Psychiatric Psychiatry ranks devotees alongside sadomasochistic fetishists, though aside from their mainstream: 1. Devotees are suppressed homosexuals. This first explanation (by Krafft-Ebbing in his 1872 Psychopathia Sexualis) rests on the assumption that amputation stumps resemble phalli and is in line with the contemporaneous linking of sexual oddity with homosexuality; 2. Devotees are sadists who consider disabled people as having a lower status, from which they derive satisfaction; 3. Devotees are masochists who seek self-denigration by associating with disabled partners; 4. Devotees are voyeurs intrigued by the unusual behaviour and appearance of disabled people; 5. Wannabes are exhibitionists seeking satisfaction in the reaction of other people; As regards points 2 to 5 above, psychology views sadism and masochism as interchangeable, with voyeurism and exhibitionism as their respective aspects. Devotees’ preference for exhibitionist-minded partners would seem to support these explanations. Further explanations include: 6. Teratophilia: the desire for deformed partners; 7. Classical fetishism: shifting the focus of desire from a person to objects. Here, it could be expected that crutches and other disability aids would feature among devotees’ sexual foci, and they do indeed feature in devotee websites; 8. Coprophilia: the fetish for excreta; since amputation stumps may be interpreted as resembling stools, devotees are assumed to be coprophiliacs. Sexological Sexologists do not consider the paraphilia a deviation unless exercising it infringes the rights of one of the parties and/or those of third parties. Explanations include: 1. Imprinting: the impact of influential events on sexual behaviour. Meeting visibly traumatised people awakes strong emotions. In children, they could give rise to quasi-logical reasoning and a desire for people with the type of trauma encountered. 2. Implied parental approval: if, when encountering a disabled person, a future devotee’s parents express admiration, infantile logic may conclude that disability is admirable, later ranking it among sexual preferences; 3. Flight from pressure: strict parenting requirements for good behaviour and academic or sporting achievements may cause the future devotee to seek respite in sickness and disability. With time, the desire to become disabled is ‘projected’ onto others. The analogy with the Munchhausen Syndrome (self-inducing illness as a way to obtain compassion and benefits) in 11 above is plain in wannabes, where projection has failed, leaving them to see themselves as more attractive with a disability. The fact that most devotees feel the attraction from childhood also backs the above explanations. 4. Transvestism and transsexuality are put forward as explanations for pretenders and wannabes. 5. The “Mars-Venus” explanation put forward by Anne Hooper (“The Amputee Fetish,” Forum, Penthouse Publications, London, June 1978) states that all men see all women as ‘amputees’ and vice-versa, the physical difference aiding attraction. Devoteeism could be regarded as a version of this; 6. “Darwinian Theory”: devotees see disabled partners as proven in natural selection, having already cheated death. Of Devotees The devotee community constantly debates the origins of the paraphilia. The Amelotatist: A Statistical Profile (Ampix [ex.], Lawndale, California, 1979), a survey setting out the results of a poll among some 400 devotees is an internal contribution and the first synthesis of many explanations. Current internal community explanations include: 1. Devoteeism as an unusual variant of physical criteria which everyone has for potential partners; 2. Disabled people perform a number of actions in original ways which capture onlookers the same way a ballerina captures audiences; 3. Devoteeism as extreme curiosity; everyone is curious about the appearance, sensation and residual functions of bodies affected by disability; 4. Devoteeism is a sexualised extension of normal human compassion; 5. It is possible that each devotee became one for a variety of personal motivations rarely replicated in other cases; 6. Devoteeism is not sexual as such, since it is often felt prior to puberty. As regards 6 above, the Freudian view is that sexual preferences (paraphilias included) are indeed formed in childhood. 7. Devoteeism is programmed so as to provide partners for disabled people; 8. Religious, occult, and esoteric explanations include hypotheses that devoteeism is sent from a higher force to test devotees and improve them by means of denial or that it is evidence of past lives. Wannabe Explanations Wannabes have not formulated explanations for the discomfort they feel, other than those listed above. A formulation doubtless borrowed from transsexuals is that for reasons unknown the soul of one with a disability sometimes finds its way into an able body and desires adjustment to the physical reality. Of Disabled People Since the disabled community is broad and diverse, explanations here emerge from that portion of it which is aware of devoteeism and whose members have in some cases adhered to the devotee community. Generally, they support devotee explanations, but with a deeper distinction between ‘devotees’ and a denigrated category of ‘fetishists’ who engage in aforementioned unacceptable and/or intrusive behaviour. Standpoints Of Devotees Devotees reject scientific approaches to the paraphilia on the grounds that scientific enquiry would throw an unhealthy shadow over them. Devotees are minded to move towards coalescing as a lifestyle community after the fashion of the gay community; today, scientific enquiry concerning the latter is generally viewed as unnecessary and discriminatory. Similarly to the gay community which rejected the term ‘homosexuality’ in favour of ‘gayness,’ devotees reject terms like ‘amelotasis’ and ‘apotemnophilia’ in favour of internal ones like ‘devoteeism.’ The community harbours conflicting views on wannabes. While pretending, until recently condemned, is today accepted as an unedifying fact of devotee life, many devotees feel wannabes have no place in their community. Devotees claim that the attraction appears deviant only from the unacceptable position that disabled people are intrinsically unattractive. Other claims are honed to present the attraction in a better light, such as the statement that devotees support the civic movement of people with disabilities. Of People with Disabilities Despite the proliferation of devotee websites and fora, most disabled people remain unaware of devoteeism. Those newly-introduced to it often react with shock and incomprehension. Nevertheless, hundreds of disabled people offer photographs and video clips of themselves for sale to devotees. This may be interpreted as approval, but also as economic accommodation. If membership of devotee fora is a sign of approval, by mid-2006, there was one disabled person for every ten devotee members of such fora. Among disabled people aware of devoteeism, positive opinions are that the two sides were “made for each other.” They state that disabled people ought not to be seen as a-priori unattractive and devoid of sexuality, and that devotees may play a positive role in this regard (Inside, The Outsiders Club, London, 1979 et seq.). Neutral opinions of disabled people aware of devoteeism are that everything in a relationship with a devotee is entirely ordinary. Negative opinions focus on the aforementioned unacceptable behaviours. A fundamental criticism concerns the inevitable stress placed by devotees on the difference between people with disabilities and able-bodied people. This is seen as a brake on integration, an aspect of which is public ‘blindness’ as to such differences. Of Observers An issue raised by feminists (though political correctness hampers its airing to some extent) is the disparity of motivations. In a putative relationship, devotees would first seek physical satiety, while their potential partners would seek satisfaction of a significantly broader range of human aspirations. This disparity ceases to be a consideration only in a purely sexual contact, yet there one ought to bear in mind possible inequalities between devotees and their partners. The major issue of wannabes is rather less abstract. It concerns medical and general ethics, as well as a number of legislations which prohibit self-harm. Treatment Literature describes therapeutic consultations with devotees, but does not describe therapeutic procedures undertaken, or their outcomes. Psychiatry considers devoteeism a deviation which can be treated by psychoanalysis, psychotherapy, counselling, or aversion therapy. Sexology does not consider the mainstream aspect of devoteeism a deviation and does not prescribe treatments. The devotee community is against therapeutic intervention for devotees but is possibly in favour if it with wannabes. === Sources === Researchers: Bruno, Richard L., "Devotees, Pretenders, and Wannabes: Two Cases of Factitious Disability Disorder," Sexuality and Disability, 15.4 (Winter 1997), pp. 243-260 Hooper, Anne, "The Amputee Fetish," Forum [exeunt], June 1978, Penthouse Publications Ltd, London Money, J., K. W. Simcoe, "Acrotomophilia, Sex, and Disability: New Concepts and Case Report," Sexuality and Disability, 7 (1984-1986), pp. 43-50 Nattress, LeRoy Jr., "The Female Amputee as an Object of Interest and Sexual Attraction," in Pfeiffer, David, Stephen C. Hey, Gary Kiger — Eds., The Disability Perspective: Variations on a Theme, Salem, Oregon, USA, The Society for Disability Studies and Willamette University, 1993 People with Disabilities: Elman, R. Amy, "Disability Pornography: The Fetishization of Women's Vulnerabilities," Violence Against Women, 3.3 (June 1997), pp. 257-270 Kafer, Alison, "Amputated Desire, Resistant Desire: Female Amputees in the Devotee Community," a paper to the Chicago Conference of the Society for Disability Studies, June 2000 Owens, Tuppy, Inside, The Outsiders Club, London, 1979 et seq. Devotees: The Amelotatist: A Statistical Profile, Ampix [exeunt], Lawndale, California, 1979 Michel Eyquem de Montaigne (1533-1592), Essays, Booke iii, Chapter xi: Of the Lame or Crippel (translated from the original French) http://devguide.org/home.shtml, a portal site to the devotee web Wannabes Carl Eliot, "Costing an Arm and a Leg: the Victims of a Growing Mental Disorder are Obsessed with Amputation" [[User:84.68.211.234|84.68.211.234]] 12:59, 8 June 2006 (UTC) == [[E3-Band]] == {{#switch:|accept={{afc a}}|mm={{afc mm}}|#default={{afc r}}}} A prominent Australian boyband, emerging in 2005, are a trio united by ethnic differences and rugged good looks. The three, Sterlo, Seva the Pimp and C.Magick, originally began with solo careers but eventually combined forces to create the worlds greatest all male group in the world. Each member of the band have a unique and gangster personality developed from childhood experiences. Sterlo is the musculine rapping black gangster, Seva is the hard eastern pimping Russian gangster, while C.Magick is the soft, handsome and intelligent Asian Kungfu gangster similar to that of Edison Chen. They do not confine themselves to one style and have created a mix of musical genres to create a very distinct sound. Their unique lyrical miracles and smooth dance moves by C.Magick eventually led to a prestigious award for their music video for L in 2005, which can be viewed on their official website www.e3-crib.co.nr. The prize, although lost by Sterlo, was a symbol of their greatness and the hard work which has lead them to worldwide fame. Their number 1 hits include, L and Bad Breath, all written and performed by E3 themselves. They also have recorded the theme song for the new National Rugby League Season for 2006.

'''Please do not modify it.''''' |} == Katelyn Avila == == [[Jessica Dracker]] == === Sources === www.bethpagecommunity.com [[User:Ingy489|Ingy489]] 14:01, 8 June 2006 (UTC) == [[Peter Warr]] == Peter Warr is a former Formula 1 team manager, most famous for his fractious relationship with Nigel Mansell whilst serving as team manager under Colin Chapman at Lotus in the mid-eighties. He is alleged to have been quoted as saying that Mansell "would never win a Grand Prix as long as I have a hole in my arse", subsequently proved wrong as Mansell went on to 31 career victories and a world championship in 1992 After Chapman's death, and Mansell's departure to Williams, Warr enjoyed considerable sucess at Lotus with a young Ayrton Senna before the team fell into decline at the end of the decade. Mansell was very critical of Warr in his autobiography, and many fans would love to read Warr's side of the story. At one stage it was thought Peter would be writing an autobiography but it would seem this plan has been abandoned. Warr now resides in France. === Sources === http://forums.atlasf1.com/showthread.php?s=d2875022cca9ff29f02f2e710385976c&postid=1251532 [[User:82.5.46.37|82.5.46.37]] 14:04, 8 June 2006 (UTC) == [[Lord of Ajasa]] == ABOUT THE LORD OF AJASSA The Nigerian Hip Hop scene is rapidly evolving and one of the new bright stars is the Lagos rhymesayer known as Lord of Ajasa. The Lord of Ajasa brings an interesting dimension to the rap game with his kamikaze flow and compelling use of Yoruba street lingo. Some may argue that these qualities are not enough to set him apart from Nigeria's army of jobbing rappers considering the fact that his themes are not a radical departure from the debauchery that characterizes today's rap music. But those with keen ears will readily agree that this Akure, Ondo State bred rapper has given us some of the wittiest and most laconic lines ever delivered in Yoruba language. Born Olusegun Osaniyi, Lord of Ajasa's interest in Hip Hop started in the early 90's when he began to pay attention to rappers like Ice Cube, Dr. Dre, Ice-T, KRS-One and NWA. Like most young rappers, he first started mimicking joints by these MCs before he started writing and delivering his own rhymes. As time progressed, he saw the need to develop his own style, one that he would not only be comfortable with, but would also appeal to a greater number of Hip Hop enthusiasts who couldn't really decipher and appreciate the lyrics of their favourite American rap stars or their counterfeit Nigerian counterparts. He started delivering his rhymes in Yoruba with a sprinkling of English and Pidgin, and focused on themes that portrayed the numerous frolics of street-smart Yoruba youngsters in contemporary Lagos. His chosen moniker, Ajasa is a Yoruba word for flavour. Lord of Ajasa has just released his debut album, a 12 track set titled, "It's tooooo much" Produced by Ajasa and his collaborative partner, Idowu Olumide a.k.a ID Cabasa. The Lord of Ajass is one of the hot new stars from MGN Productions. He hails from Nigeria and has been entertaining since he was a child. He is out now on Blue Pie Productions for the world and is available at all leading digital retailers. *************************************** THE FACTS: Real Name: Olusegun Gbadura Osaniyi Stage Name: Lord of Ajasa Family Background: Family of five I am the forth born I’m from Ondo State and a native of Ikare - Akoko Which year did you start: I started professionally in the year 2000 Awards: The best indigenous rapper for the year 2000 Afro-Hip-Hop Awards organized shrine Nigeria. Best creative for year 2005. ‘‘Gbedu Awards’’ Relaxation mood: Write, watch movies, playing music. Thoughts for the world: Be yourself, believe in yourself, in anything you do Be persistant and don’t give up on your dreams. Thank You very much for appreciating my music. They offer state of the art cosmetic procedures and products that can help you achieve the look you've always imagined. Many offices providing cosmetic procedures are staffed by people with little training or medical experience. Their board-certified physician, Dr. Cynthia Elliott, and her specially trained and licensed medical staff provide only the cosmetic surgery treatments they consider effective and safe for each patient. They specialize in cosmetic surgery treatments for your face and body in an office that is friendly, down-to-earth, and discrete (they have a separate exit door for departing clients). Many of their procedures have little if any down time and can be performed in less than an hour. They provide flexible hours, so you can choose the time that's most convenient for you. They also offer cosmetic medical products only available through a doctor's office including Obagi, Cellex-C, SkinMedica, Glytone, Nucelle and Physician's Complex. They also carry the Jane Iredale mineral makeup line. He was was born in 1974. He was born in Sydney and educated at Sydney University. Andy Benke began Djing in 1998 and soon rose to the top of his field as Sydney goodtime party DJ. He had begun his DJing career working at "The Fringe Bar" in Paddington in 1997 and soon worked at the trendy Darlinghurst bar "Lotel". Soon after he was working at Sydneys top hiphop club called "Mr Goodbar" where he was trained by one of Sydneys top hip hop dj's Cool Hand Luke. He remained a resident DJ at Goodbar till 2002. During his time at Goodbar, he was offered a residency at Sydney's top bar/lounge Cargo Bar where he has been a resident for the past four years. He has toured locally and internationally. Presently he is DJing at Cargo Bar, The Fringe Bar, The Cabana Bar and The North Wollongong Hotel. He is apparently single. === Sources === http://www.inthemix.com.au/whatson/show/30117/ http://www.liveguide.com.au/liveguide_mainpage.cfm?currently_searching=true&search_multi_type=artist&search_multi=mark%20dynamix http://www.departreality.com/452/473.html [[User:203.206.252.19|203.206.252.19]] 11:23, 15 February 2007 (UTC) [[User:203.166.246.206|203.166.246.206]] 15:34, 8 June 2006 (UTC) == [[ Aileen Terrace Newry ]] == === Sources === Coly lives there == Genetic Counsellor == Genetic counselling translates scientific knowledge into practical information. Providers of genetic counselling have a strong background in biology, and in particular, genetics. Genetic counsellors are health professionals with specialized education, training, and experience in medical genetics and counselling. They help families understand birth defects and how inheritance works. They provide information to help families make personal decisions about pregnancy and child care. A genetic counsellor works with a person or family who may be at risk for inherited disease or an abnormal pregnancy outcome by discussing the chances of having children who are affected. When you go to see a genetic counsellor, he or she will record your medical background and family medical history. The counsellor may arrange appointments for blood tests, physical exams, or amniocentesis in order to put together a picture of how your family's health may affect your children. Genetic counsellors also help you interpret medical information about any risks present and explain the role of genetics for these conditions. Often, they can determine the risk of occurrence or recurrence of a condition and the availability of tests for it. == Indiavision Channel == Indiavision is Malayalam based channel mainly with News Broadcast live & recorded. === Sources === Indian Television Records == banshees (band) == Banshees is a screamo/post hardcore band from Brunswick, ME drawing influences from "cheap beer" and a barrage of bands from various sub genres of hardcore. Oppenheim, Biological Constructs for Physical Principles: A discussion on Open T Theory, preprint 2006 [[User:62.56.62.159|62.56.62.159]] 17:37, 8 June 2006 (UTC) == [[ Clint "Hawk" Thomas ]] == {{#switch:accept|accept={{afc a}}|mm={{afc mm}}|#default={{afc r}}}} Clint Thomas was born in Greenup, Kentucky in 1896. Thomas was an outfielder and second baseman in the Negro Leagues from 1920-1937, where he earned the nickname "Hawk" for his sharp eyed hitting and center field skills. During his career Thomas spent time playing, most notably, with the New York Black Yankees, but also with the Brooklyn Royal Giants, Columbus Buckeyes, Detroit Stars, Hilldale , Bacharach Giants, New York Lincoln Giants, New York Cubans, Newark Eagles, and Philadelphia Stars. During his nearly 20 year career Thomas racked an impressive 400 home runs and 4,000 career hits and was a member of the 1925 and 1926 Eastern Colored League Championship Philadelphia Hilldale teams. Thomas joined the New York Black Yankees in 1931 and, the following year, "ruined" the opening of Greenlee Field by scoring the only run and making a game saving catch in the Black Yankees defeat of [[Satchel Paige]]'s Philadelphia Crawfords. After his baseball career ended, Thomas took work at the Virginia State House, where one of his duties was to make coffee for the state legislators. === Sources === http://www.baseballlibrary.com/baseballlibrary/ballplayers/T/Thomas_Clint.stm http://www.uky.edu/Subject/aakyall.html [[User:216.136.59.189|216.136.59.189]] 17:39, 8 June 2006 (UTC) Jeremy D. He has been the yearbook adviser since the school's opening in 1994, and was also the newspaper at that time. As of the 2005-2006 school year, he again became newspaper adviser. As yearbook adviser, he won the 2004 National Yearbook Adviser of the Year from JEA. http://www.jea.org/awards/yaoy04.html He graduated with a master's degree from Ball State, and has experience as a journalist and yearbook adviser. He been an adviser for 11 years at the middle school level and 13 years at the high school level. Also, he was an adviser at Burris Lab School in Muncie, Indiana, while attending Ball State. He became an intern at a local paper the summer after he graduated from high school, and he became the sports editor of the 10,000 circulation paper at the age of 18. He served as sports editor from 1972 to 1979. He wrote, designed, photographed, and edited 1 to 2 broadsheet pages every day, covering five area high schools and Sacramento regional sports for the Roseville Press-Tribune. In 1978 the paper won a California Newspaper Publishers Award for Best Local Sports Coverage. Nichols also won a Best Feature Photo Award in 1977. At Rocklin High, he teaches two Publications 2/3 classes and one Publications 1 class, all of which contribute to the making of the yearbook. He also teaches Journalism 1 and Journalism 2/3, which currently writes for and edits the school newspaper, although it will be switching to a magazine format as of 2006-2007. Lastly, he created the curriculum for a Photojournalism class, which shoots the majority of the yearbook photographs and prepares students for futures in photography and photojournalism. His main goal is to always improve the yearbook at Rocklin High School. He believes that everything can always get better, and has reiterated that if he ever made a perfect yearbook, he would resign his post as adviser and retire. Nichols has also said that the key to a great yearbook is great photography. His wife Sarah Nichols is the yearbook adviser for newly opened Whitney High School of the Rocklin Unified School District. http://www.rocklin.k12.ca.us/ The Rocklin High School Yearbook website is http://rhs.rocklin.k12.ca.us/cnichols/yearbook/. === Sources === Carl Emond is the co- founder of the Hell's Angels in Thunder Bay. Appointed Bluemantle Pursuivant of Arms in 1849 and promoted to His Majesty's Chester Herald at Arms in 1864. In 1867 he was also secretary to Garter Mission at the Court of St. Petersburg. He was the author of several books, including "Lane of Bentley Hall" (1898, Eliot Stock, London), a fully researched history of the Lane family going back to 1066. He was a direct descendant of Colonel John Lane, brother of [[Jane Lane]], the English heroine who saved the life of [[Charles II]] after [[The Battle of Worcester]] in 1651. === Sources === Lane of Bentley Hall, 1898, Eliot Stock, London. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Joseph-Watkin - [[User:4.250.147.242|4.250.147.242]] 18:39, 8 June 2006 (UTC)

Is set in struggle, from his birth. Throughout the span of shortened dearth, so longing to gain a sense of worth. Told, by those gathered round, "Its in his hands," where “worth” is found.” Wearied, by those who measured his task. So, now his strength does fail to last. For if to look within this Man. Is to know it's not his hand, whereby we know the worth of this Man, But, by the gift, so given for him to have this Man forgiven of sin. From the one whom “worth” is given. The Rev. === Sources === http://manifestingsons.blogspot.com/2004_12_01_manifestingsons_archive.html [[User:Awaken4e1|Awaken4e1]] 19:51, 8 June 2006 (UTC) == Beating your head against the Rock == Enveloped deep within the crevasse of a cold and dark mountain cave, stumbles a very weary worn, and tattered eaglet, struggling to find a safe place for which to molt. The helpless, immature and undeveloped fowl instinctively knows that if it is to survive, it must search out a smooth and flat-faced rock of sufficient density, to beat its head on. In order to break open the thick and crusting hide of its fledgling body. And, if it is not properly hidden from predators, it will be devoured before its birth into maturity arrives. Now, that this body’s skin has reached the end of this stage of development, and is tightening around its muscles and slowly chocking the life out of it. And it will not continue to live if it does not grow out of it. For this insufficient skin cannot form the mature feather with which it must have to fly above all other birds of the earth. And with the breaking of this outer hide causes the blood to flow out of its head. And as the blood flows, it blinds the flow to the outside world. Now, alone in the dark it must use all of its God-given strength to remove this old hide that it keeping it from its full ability to soar. The blood softens the crust around the mouth, and eyes and can now be scraped off by the same rock which it has beaten its head against, for what would seem to be a life time. For three days it hides in the darkness of the world, falling on the rock to remove this dead skin from its body. It is defenseless from any attackers that would happen upon it; therefore it must act in a way unbecoming of an Eagle it must humble itself, and hide from the sunlight. But at the end of this endless ordeal, emerges strengthened and renew and in its new body of maturity in which it now Soars! The Rev. === Sources === http://manifestingsons.blogspot.com/2004_12_01_manifestingsons_archive.html [[User:Awaken4e1|Awaken4e1]] 19:53, 8 June 2006 (UTC) == This is mine hour == I dedicate these words to my loving Wife, and family: I pray, to the Father for all of those who read these words, and that they understand the purpose for their lives, As they find themselves, and their true identity in Christ through these words, I thank the Father for all those whom, never gave up on their friendship, and brotherhood with me, Amen… In this last hour, there is a grievous crisis within the body of Christ. A great dependence on the traditions and denominations of men has befallen it. The teachings of men have brought confusion to the body of Christ. God’s people have been lulled into believing that the greater the emotional draw, and ‘entertainment flare’ equals a closer the walk with God. Believing that the greater the number of members is proof of the greater the walk with God. Steering the church into an emotional dependency in man, and not a spiritual dependency in God. Making the church powerless, and unable to find her place of authority in the Kingdom of God. The church holds these teachings as Gospel, and therefore not searching out the Word to find the truth, personally. The church has become dull of hearing. Not knowing, the voice of the Holy Spirit in their personal lives. The denominationalism of the church has kept Man in his spiritual infancy. This has cause Man to take on a religious nature. The carnal mind, and the souls of men have been given power over the people. Through conflict and strife the church, has built impassable walls. Even to the point of hatred, and envy between denominations. Because of this God has hidden this word, for The Sons to discover. For this purpose, I began to hear the voice of God, but at the time I did not, fully understand what God was showing me. I have throughout my walk been given insight into God’s Word through spiritual discernment, and the power of His spoken word, and symbolism. Through the mind of Christ, working in me. “I pray that Lord of Hosts lead you as you read these words”. ‘Let this mind be in you’ which is in Christ Jesus. I have been given, to see man’s manipulation through the translations of the Word. And, that it is imperative to those who are ‘the called’ according to His purpose; ‘the Sons of God’… know the truth of the Word in this hour. This is the beginning of the revelation into the “mysteries” of the Word… I would let it be known that I do not hold any of these truths of myself, nor do I exalt myself of anything. But I digress, All Praise and the Glory be unto Him, who sits on the throne. ‘The King of Kings, and Lord of Lords’, Amen… Let us begin, by setting some foundational truths, and understandings in Genesis. First, God has created Man, a spiritual creature, first, and then a physical form, second. The physical formation of man comes through the working of the fall, later, much later in his walk with God. As a result of Mans encounter with the mixture of “good and evil”, Man began to indulge himself in rational thought, through the carnal mind. And this being new to Man, and being unprepared, because of doubt, he began to look at God’s creation through the eyes of limitations, and want. He began to see through the mind of fear, and doubt. In this new realm the Man hide himself. *Gen 3:9 And Jehovah God calleth unto the man, and saith to him, `Where art thou?' *Gen 3:10 and he saith, `Thy sound I have heard in the garden, and I am afraid, for I am naked, and I hide myself.' *Gen 3:11 And He saith, `Who hath declared to thee that thou art naked? Of the tree of which I have commanded thee not to eat, hast thou eaten?' We have for thousands of years hide among the “trees of men”. Here our Father asks, Adom ‘who has told you were naked?’ And the answer is, his carnal mind, twisted through satan ‘the traducer’. Through the weighing of good and evil through ‘reason’ Man began to believe a lie, through the twisting of the truth. *Gen 3:5 for God doth know that in the day of your eating of it--your eyes have been opened, and ye have been as God, knowing good and evil.' Man had began to except his carnal, and physical world as reality, and not just a part of the sleep under which God had placed him, to form him, and to perfect his soul-‘Eve’. God seeing the Man had partaken of ‘the knowledge’ of good and evil, God formed Man with all of the necessary senses, to walk out this process, of knowing good and evil in this physical world. God clothed the man with skins (not the skins of beasts), but the enclosure in which we now walk. This is the formation of Man into a physical body. This is “The Fall of Man”. This ‘makes man’ flesh, as a result of the fall into the mixture. Man is now a Hued-Man, or as we know it ‘Human’. This is literally a mixed-up Man, because Man cannot see the plan of God from within the fall. These are two distinctly different events in Man’s walk with his Creator. First, that which is spiritual, timeless, and boundless, and then that which is natural, flesh, limited, measured, and counted. Man is an eternal being, as is his Father, God. This is the process, which God has chosen to complete Man, to know the fullness of good and evil, which brings man to the understanding of the great gift, which God has given unto man through the working of the cross. This must be the beginning, of understanding, and that Man is on the path of perfection, even today. Walking through good and evil within the garden of man’s spirit. Man is beginning to see the fullness of his relationship with his Father. Through, man’s struggle to return to the Father, without spot or blemish. Perfected! Knowing this is the very fabric of God’s Word, and Man’s true understanding of it. For it is the pleasure of the King to hide a mystery, and the honor of the ‘sons’ to revel unto the World. In Genesis Chapter 1:1. From the very beginning God has set Man’s place within His Creation, to set first Heaven ‘Man’s –spirit’, and then his Earth-‘soul’. ccnp study guide ISBN 0-7821-4421-7 [[User:88.96.2.113|88.96.2.113]] 22:47, 8 June 2006 (UTC)HaCKeT|FiZZ == [[Nobilissima visione - Suite for Orchestra]] == Composed in 1938, Nobilissima visione was premiered by the Ballet Russe de Monte Carlo under the composer’s direction at Covent Garden, London, on July 21, 1928, with choreography by Massine. Scoring: 2 flutes (one doubling piccolo), 2 oboes, 2 clarinets, 2 bassoons, 4 horns, 2 trumpets, 3 trombones, timpani, percussion (snare drum, tenor drum, bass drum, glockenspiel, triangle, cymbals, and small cymbals), and strings. Aside from Hindemith’s highly developed conception of the composer’s role as a social one, involving a moral duty to provide music that people can use and enjoy, the all-round character of his musicianship—he acquired a degree of competence in playing practically all of the orchestral instruments—suggests a return to the practice of the 18th century, when composers were normally skilled executants too. This tendency is in one sense reflected in his music, in which counterpoint often regains the central role it filled until the late baroque period. But it was perhaps in the sphere of harmony, where he developed a method admittedly less influential on other composers than that of his older contemporary Schoenberg but better fitted for the creative tasks he set himself. The great merit of his system is that, unlike Schoenberg’s 12-tone method, it is based on a natural rather than an arbitrary division of the octave: he treated notes as harmonics ultimately derived from one fundamental, grading chords from strong to weak according to how near their constituent notes were to the fundamental. The ease and fluency attainable through such methods are clearly to be heard in a score like Nobilissima visione, which postdates the composer’s early period as a kind of enfant terrible, and instead calls to mind the warmth, underlying serenity, and, indeed, nobility of such familiar works as the symphony he similarly drew from his opera Mathis der Maler. The Nobilissima visione suite consists, the composer explained, “of those sections of the ballet score which are self-sufficient and comprehensible as concert music and which do not depend, therefore, on supplementary stage action.” His description of these sections is as follows: The introduction consists of that part of the original music during which the hero of the action (St. Francis of Assisi) is sunk in deep meditation. The Rondo corresponds to the music in the stage score for the mystic union of the Saint to Mistress Poverty, the scene having been inspired by an old Tuscan legend. The music reflects the blessed peace and unworldly cheer with which the guests at the wedding participate in the wedding feast—dry bread and water only. The second movement pictures the march of a troop of medieval soldiers. First heard but distantly, their gradual approach is observed. The middle portion of this movement suggests the brutality with which these mercenaries set upon a traveling burgher and rob him. The third and closing movement, Passacaglia, corresponds to the portion of the ballet score representing the Hymn to the Sun. Here all the symbolic personifications of heavenly and earthly existence mingle in the course of the different variations through which the six-measure-long theme of the Passacaglia is transformed. In the ballet this closing piece bears a special title borrowed from a chapter heading in an old version of the Cantique du Soleil, which reads, “Incipiunt laudes creaturarum”—“Here begin the praises of all creatures.” Perhaps the loveliest part of the whole score is the contemplative Pastorale that concludes the second movement, based on a theme remarkable for its combination of poetry and elegance. This melody exemplifies the rhythmic suppleness and the expressive, but never excessive, chromaticism at the heart of Hindemith’s finest music. === Sources === http://www.grovemusic.com/ [[User:Florestan98926|Florestan98926]] 23:09, 8 June 2006 (UTC) == [ [The Stopouts] ] == The Stopouts are a ska/punk group hailing from Merseyside. Won SCCA Runoffs in the Formula Atlantic class, also becoming the youngest national champion ever. - '''2006''' Racing in the Champ Car Toyota Atlantic as well as the A1 GP series. === Sources === http://www.grahamrahal.com == [[Lydiate Hall]] == Before the fifteenth century manor houses needed to be fortified in case of attack to do this they had outer walls, a moat, a drawbridge and a portcullis. Early drawings of manor houses illustrate this. Lydiate hall itself shows evidence of a moat. The windows were small as well. This changed in Elizabethan times when houses developed to have big, high windows with a symmetrical building. An example being Hardwick house – 1590. Lydiate hall doesn’t show evidence of this. Manor houses were usually 2 to 3 stories high built around an open courtyard. The manor houses built before the fifteenth century and were built from wood and so the kitchen was situated away from the main house to prevent the spread of fire. The main living room had different uses including eating, sleeping and recreation. The great hall at Lydiate reproduced from Rimmer in 1852 shows the large room with a table for eating and a fireplace. This source is reliable because other manor houses show the same styles of great halls from that period.. Rufford old hall’s great hall shows exuberance of decoration and five hammerbeam trusses it also shows a table and fireplace. A bed can also be seen to the left of the picture. During the fifteenth century threat of attack was lessened and so fortification was lessened. The kitchen also became part of the house because the roof was vaulted to prevent the spread of fire. Manor houses were built from brick, stone or half-timber. There was more space for private bedrooms or receptions. A porch was built and a barn for animals. Pictures from the guidebook of Lydiate hall from this period are useful to historians because it shows what manor houses looked like during the fifteenth century and they can compare the pictures from earlier illustrations and compare the sources to see how they have developed. During the early sixteenth century timber became expensive and houses were built from stone or brick. They had very large windows like those of Hardwick house. The houses became a lot grander and spacious. Pictures of Speke hall show it made these changes. The house was rented out and used as a farmhouse. Houses during Tudor times were still based around an open courtyard i.e. they were quadrangular. The Speke hall guidebook shows a picture of the house designed around an open courtyard and the plans of the house also illustrate this clearly. Victoria county history describes Lydiate hall to be quadrangular around an open courtyard as well. So there is sufficient evidence to support this. Lydiate hall was typically tudur showing evidence of bay windows and chimneys being introduced. The floor was made from wood and staircases were becoming more common in houses. Pictures of Lydiate hall’s great hall show a staircase. Timber framed bricks were introduced. Other houses like Rufford old hall and Speke hall show these developments as well. This proves that Lydiate hall did develop so it is useful to historians. Hardwick hall is a late Tudor house built during the reign of the last Tudor monarch Elizabeth I. This shows typical Tudor symmetry and large high windows and a high building. The plans of 1637 show the layout of Lydiate Hall before the demolition of the east wing in the 18th century. It is therefore useful to historians who can look at how the layout of the manor house changed considering it is in ruins now. During the 17th century manor houses became even larger and very symmetrical however Lydiate doesn’t show evidence of this and so shows it did not develop along with other manor houses like Speke hall. The 18th century saw a farm building constructed in 1741 but elsewhere few changes took place at the manor house. In 1741 it was found that the roof of the east block needed repairing but because the family live in another manor house, ins Blundell, it was pulled down and the house was rented out to be used for farming to a man called John Rimmer Since that date the manor house has not developed to follow styles like others did but it was reconstructed to copy Elizabethan styles, like red brickwork and 16th century style windows. This restoration could be useful to show historians how Lydiate hall would have looked like but may also not be useful because it might not show exact styles of the times. Lydiate hall has had lots of restoration carried out and so there is little left of the original building work. When I visited there was mainly remains of the red brick, which was used to restore the Manor house. In 1960 there was a lot more timber at the site and some of it containing carvings and other examples of sixteenth century timberwork. This would have been useful to historians. Historians can only use restored material and sources, which could be slightly inaccurate. There is however opportunities with the decay of the house to see the materials used in the building and these can be dated. Archaeological excavations have found the timber, which can be dated back to the medieval times when it was thought most of Lydiate hall was built. In conclusion from when Lydiate hall was built until the end of the Tudor period it followed trends of the time and developed. This is evident in sources. However after this period it stopped following the fashions and when the family decided not to repair the building it started to deteriorate and so is not a reliable source of development after that period because it is based on restoration work which may not be as reliable as other manor hoses like Hardwick house and Speke Hall. === Sources === Lydiate Hall Guidebook by Stephen Manning Sascha Bonomally [[User:82.42.81.167|82.42.81.167]] 23:43, 8 June 2006 (UTC) == [ [Straight out of Line] ] == This song is a response to fans who acuuse them of selling out.
